content.body: I’m looking at simplifying Ecma262’s definition of Array.from to use %Array.prototype.values%, like how https://tc39.es/proposal-array-from-async/#sec-array.fromAsync uses %Array.prototype.values%. As far as I can tell, this should be editorial, but, if so, would it still deserve to be presented as a 2022-09 plenary agenda item?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I’m looking at simplifying Ecma262’s definition of Array.from to use %Array.prototype.values%, like how https://tc39.es/proposal-array-from-async/#sec-array.fromAsync uses %Array.prototype.values%. As far as I can tell, this should be editorial, but, if so, would it still deserve to be presented as a 2022-09 plenary agenda item?

content.body: jschoi: anything strictly editorial does not need to be presented in plenary
content.formatted_body: jschoi: anything strictly editorial does not need to be presented in plenary

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: jschoi: anything strictly editorial does not need to be presented in plenary
jschoi: anything strictly editorial does not need to be presented in plenary

content.body: but, `Array.prototype.values` produces an iterator which uses the _current_ value of `%ArrayIteratorPrototype%.next`, which is not what `Array.from` does
content.formatted_body: but, Array.prototype.values produces an iterator which uses the current value of %ArrayIteratorPrototype%.next, which is not what Array.from does

content.body: so it's not a totally straightforward refactoring
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: so it's not a totally straightforward refactoring

content.body: This might be a problem for the currently proposed Array.fromAsync algorithm too, then.
